title: About Us | Mekor 3
headings: Serve the Center City Jewish Community
text: Skip to Main Content Membership Events Donate Kiddush Center City Beit Midrash Join Us Davening Who We Are Kosher Restaurants More Support Mekor About Us Our History Mekor Habracha began as an independent chavura in the Rittenhouse Square area of Philadelphia in the 1990s. From 1999 to 2001, the group met under the auspices of Etz Chaim (now Aish Chaim), before returning to a primarily lay-led model. In 2006, Etz Chaim recruited Rabbi Eliezer Hirsch from New York to serve as the group’s rabbi. Since Rabbi Hirsch’s arrival, the congregation has grown and flourished, becoming an independent synagogue in 2008, and is now a vital force in strengthening Jewish life in Center City. Mekor has played a key role in supporting the expansion of kosher dining, helping establish a community eruv, spearheading the building of a mikvah, and sponsoring many Orthodox converts to Judaism.​ ​ In 2024, Rabbi Steven Gotlib joined Mekor Habracha as Associate Rabbi. His thoughtful leadership, strong Torah scholarship, and deep sense of connection to the community have already made a meaningful impact, complementing Rabbi Hirsch’s vision and helping guide the congregation into its next chapter. ​ You can read more about Mekor's origins and development here, and find a recent article about our community here. Contact Us Load More Contact US We'd love to hear from you! First Name Last Name Email Message Submit Mekor Habracha Center City Synagogue (215) 525-4246 admin@mekorhabracha.org ​ 1500 Walnut St Suite 206 Philadelphia, PA 19102 SUBSCRIBE TO OUR WEEKLY NEWSLETTER Enter your email here SUBSCRIBE Latest Newsletters Copyright ©2025 by Mekor Habracha Synagogue

line-height:1.4em;"><span style="font-size:40px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:lulo-clean-w01-one-bold;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-weight:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-style:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="color:rgb(63, 67, 89);" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="letter-spacing:0em;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:56px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">Our History</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></span></h2></div><!--/$--><!--$--><div id="comp-m5zn3g22" class="ku3DBC zQ9jDz qvSjx3 Vq6kJx comp-m5zn3g22 wixui-rich-text" data-testid="richTextElement"><p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:18px;"><span style="font-size:18px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">Mekor Habracha began as an independent chavura in the Rittenhouse Square area of Philadelphia in the 1990s. </span></p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:18px;"> </p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:18px;"><span style="font-size:18px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">From 1999 to 2001, the group met under the auspices of Etz Chaim (now <span style="text-decoration:underline;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><a href="https://aishchaim.com/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="wixui-rich-text__text">Aish Chaim</a></span>), before returning to a primarily lay-led model. In 2006, Etz Chaim recruited Rabbi Eliezer Hirsch from New York to serve as the group’s rabbi. </span></p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:18px;"> </p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:18px;"><span style="font-size:18px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">Since Rabbi Hirsch’s arrival, the congregation has grown and flourished, becoming an independent synagogue in 2008, and is now a vital force in strengthening Jewish life in Center City. Mekor has played a key role in supporting <span style="text-decoration:underline;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><a href="/center-city" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="wixui-rich-text__text">the expansion of kosher dining, </a></span> helping establish a <span style="text-decoration:underline;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><a href="http://www.centercityeruv.org/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="wixui-rich-text__text">community eruv</a></span>, spearheading the building of a <span style="text-decoration:underline;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><a href="https://philamikvah.org/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="wixui-rich-text__text">mikvah,</a></span></span></p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:18px;"><span style="font-size:18px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="wixui-rich-text__text">and sponsoring many Orthodox converts to Judaism.​</span></span></p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:18px;"><span style="font-size:18px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="wixui-rich-text__text">​</span></span></p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:18px;"><span style="font-size:18px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">In 2024, Rabbi Steven Gotlib joined Mekor Habracha as Associate Rabbi. His thoughtful leadership, strong Torah scholarship, and deep sense of connection to the community have already made a meaningful impact, complementing Rabbi Hirsch’s vision and helping guide the congregation into its next chapter.</span></p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:18px;"><span style="font-size:18px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span class="wixui-rich-text__text">​</span></span></p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:18px;"><span style="font-size:18px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">You can read more about Mekor's origins and development </span><span style="font-size:18px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="text-decoration:underline;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><a href="https://mekorhabracha.github.io/2013/10/16/modern-orthodox-community.html" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="wixui-rich-text__text">here</a></span></span><span style="font-size:18px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">, and find a recent article about our community </span><span style="font-size:18px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="text-decoration:underline;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><a href="https://www.jewishexponent.com/mekor-habracha-continues-to-bring-orthodox-vibrancy-to-center-city/" target="_blank" rel="noreferrer noopener" class="wixui-rich-text__text">here</a></span></span><span style="font-size:18px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">.</span></p></div><!--/$--><!--$--><div id="comp-m5zn7li0" wixui-rich-text" data-testid="richTextElement"><p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:16px; line-height:1.8em;"><span style="color:#000000;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">​Mekor Habracha is a vibrant and inclusive congregation located in Center City, Philadelphia. We have a diverse membership from all across the city, and visitors, whether local residents or out-of-towners, are always welcome.</span></p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:16px; line-height:1.8em;"><span style="color:#000000;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">Since it was founded in 2007, the Shul has attracted, and continues to attract a diverse group of people including students, young professionals, newlyweds, families, and empty nesters. We offer a range of religious, educational, and social activities, as well as plenty of opportunities for community members to get involved. </span></p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:16px; line-height:1.8em;"><span style="color:#000000;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">We are proud that a number of wonderfully matched married couples first met at Mekor. Check out the growing list of "Mekor Couples" <span style="text-decoration:underline;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><a href="/mekorcouples" target="_self" class="wixui-rich-text__text">here</a></span>.</span></p></div><!--/$--><!--$--><div id="comp-m8qls6fg1__item-kicx9qyp" class="v__F4U comp-m8qls6fg1__item-kicx9qyp wixui-image"><div wixui-rich-text" data-testid="richTextElement"><p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:16px; line-height:1.8em;"><span style="color:#3F4359;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:16px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:helvetica-w01-light;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-weight:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-style:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="letter-spacing:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:16px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">At Mekor, we strive for transformative Jewish learning, putting the texts of our tradition in dialogue with pressing issues in our lives. Our community is turned to for the unique philosophy we represent in our sermons, classes, and publications. </span></span></span></span></span></span></span></p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:16px; line-height:1.8em;"><span style="color:#3F4359;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:16px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:helvetica-w01-light;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-weight:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-style:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="letter-spacing:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:16px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">Our approach to Jewish learning is both profound and practical, addressing real-life issues through a blend of substantive dialogue with Jewish tradition and texts, a desire for genuine and personal spiritual exploration, and a passion for truth. </span></span></span></span></span></span>​</span><span style="color:#3F4359;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:16px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:helvetica-w01-light;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-weight:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-style:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="letter-spacing:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:16px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">​</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></p>

<p class="font_8 wixui-rich-text__text" style="font-size:16px; line-height:1.8em;"><span style="color:#3F4359;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:16px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-family:helvetica-w01-light;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-weight:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-style:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="letter-spacing:normal;" class="wixui-rich-text__text"><span style="font-size:16px;" class="wixui-rich-text__text">This methodology, influenced by Rabbi Hirsch's esteemed teachers who were and are revolutionary thinkers and halachic experts (poskim), brings all of Torah in conversation with modern life, offering a holistic and profound religious education.</span></span></span></span></span></span></span></p></div><!--/$--></div></div></div><!--/$--></fluid-columns-repeater></div></div><!--/$--></div></div></section><!--/$--><!--$--><section id="comp-m5zo15ah" tabindex="-1" class="Oqnisf comp-m5zo15ah wixui-section" data-block-level-container="ClassicSection"><div id="bgLayers_comp-m5zo15ah" data-hook="bgLayers" data-motion-part="BG_LAYER comp-m5zo15ah" class="MW5IWV"><div data-testid="colorUnderlay" class="LWbAav Kv1aVt"></div><div id="bgMedia_comp-m5zo15ah" data-motion-part="BG_MEDIA comp-m5zo15ah" class="VgO9Yg"></div></div><div data-mesh-id="comp-m5zo15ahinlineContent" data-testid="inline-content" class=""><div data-mesh-id="comp-m5zo15ahinlineContent-gridContainer" data-testid="mesh-container-content"><!--$--><div id="comp-m5zo4lc3" class="  comp-m5zo4lc3"><div class="comp-m5zo4lc3"><style>.comp-m5zo4lc3 {
